title: How to Move Columns in Excel: Rearrange with 2 Easy Methods

steps.title: Click the letter above the column you want to move.
steps.content: Click the letter above the column you want to move. This selects the column. In this method, you’ll use the mouse to drag the column to a new position. This works on Windows and macOS. This method only works for a single column. To move multiple columns, use cut and paste commands (see next method). Moving columns is a great way to set up your spreadsheet for a Vlookup or Sum formula. For general spreadsheet tips, check out our guide on making a spreadsheet in Excel .

steps.title: Hover the mouse over the border of the selected column.
steps.content: Hover the mouse over the border of the selected column. The cursor will turn into four arrows (Windows) or a hand (macOS). [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source The cursor will turn into a hand in the web app version of Excel.

steps.title: Drag the column to the desired location.
steps.content: Drag the column to the desired location. Click and drag the selected column to the location where you want to move it, and then release the mouse button. This will cut and replace the column. [2] X Research source If you want to copy and replace columns instead of just moving them, hold down Ctrl (Windows) or ⌥ Option (macOS) while dragging and dropping. Holding ⇧ Shift will cut and insert the columns. Holding Ctrl + ⇧ Shift will copy and insert the columns.

steps.title: Click the letter above the column you want to move.
steps.content: Click the letter above the column you want to move. This selects the column. The commands method only works on the Windows version of Excel. To move more than one (adjacent) column at the same time, hold down Ctrl as you click each column letter. Formatting your spreadsheet can significantly improve your Excel experience.

steps.title: Press Ctrl+X.
steps.content: Press Ctrl + X . This “cuts” the data in the column, which really just selects it and adds it to the clipboard. [3] X Research source The column data will remain in its place until you paste it into its new location. You can also cut the column by clicking the scissors icon on the Home tab. It’s in the “Clipboard” section near the top-left corner of the app. If you cut the wrong column, press Esc to return the data to its original location.

steps.title: Right-click the letter above the column to the right of where you want to move the data.
steps.content: Right-click the letter above the column to the right of where you want to move the data. A drop-down menu will open. When you insert your copied data, it'll be to the left of the column you right-click.

steps.title: Click Insert Cut Cells on the right-click menu.
steps.content: Click Insert Cut Cells on the right-click menu. Excel will insert the cut column to the left of the one on which you right-clicked. [4] X Research source If you want to undo the pasted column, press Ctrl + Z . Alternatively, you can click the drop-down icon next to the Insert button on the Home toolbar at the top, and select Insert Cut Cells or Insert Cells here. This will insert and move your data the same way.
